title: How to Make a Small 3D Atom Model

steps.title: Prepare your materials.
steps.content: Prepare your materials. You will need glue, scissors, cardstock, string, 40 large craft balls (20 of one color for the protons and the other 20 for the neutrons that's a different color), and 20 small craft balls for the electrons.

steps.title: Glue the protons and neutrons together.
steps.content: Glue the protons and neutrons together. Glue both colored craft balls into a ball, alternating between the protons and neutrons as you glue.This will resemble the nucleus. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cut out the cardstock.
steps.content: Cut out the cardstock. Cut out a small, a medium, a large, and an extra-large ring using the scissors. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tie the rings.
steps.content: Tie the rings. Using the string, tie all the rings in a concentric circle around the nucleus.

steps.title: Glue on the electrons.
steps.content: Glue on the electrons. Glue two small craft balls to the small circle, eight on the medium circle, eight to the large circle, and then two to the extra-large circle. These will resemble all the electrons on the atom.

steps.title: Attach a piece of string to the outer circle to help the model hang.
steps.content: Attach a piece of string to the outer circle to help the model hang.

steps.title: Enjoy!
steps.content: Enjoy! You can now show off and display your 3D model of the atom calcium.

steps.title: Prepare your materials.
steps.content: Prepare your materials. You will need 16 medium-sized polystyrene balls, a paint brush, three different paint colors, 8 small polystyrene balls, strong craft glue, an eye hook, wire, duct tape, and a fishing line.

steps.title: Paint 8 of the polystyrene balls a paint color.
steps.content: Paint 8 of the polystyrene balls a paint color. Use the paint brush to brush the paint over only 8 of the medium sized balls. [3] X Research source It's recommended to use the color blue as these balls will resemble the protons. Allow the balls to dry until they are no longer wet.

steps.title: Paint the other 8 balls a different color.
steps.content: Paint the other 8 balls a different color. Repeat the same process with the other 8 balls. [4] X Research source Paint the balls another color, preferably red since this is resembling the neutrons, and set them aside to allow it to dry.

steps.title: Paint the small polystyrene balls another color.
steps.content: Paint the small polystyrene balls another color. Using the paint brush, paint the 8 small balls another color, preferably green to resemble the electrons. [5] X Research source Set the balls aside to dry until they are no longer wet.

steps.title: Glue the medium-sized balls together.
steps.content: Glue the medium-sized balls together. Using the strong craft glue, glue both different colored medium-sized balls together to resemble a nucleus, alternating between the protons and neutrons as you glue. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Screw the eye hook on top of the 'nucleus'.
steps.content: Screw the eye hook on top of the 'nucleus'.

steps.title: Thread and poke the small balls onto a piece of wire.
steps.content: Thread and poke the small balls onto a piece of wire. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Form the wire into medium-sized hoops.
steps.content: Form the wire into medium-sized hoops. Gently form the wire into hoops to resemble the atom. Secure the wire and atom together using the duct tape. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tie the fishing line on the hoops and eye hook to help the model hang.
steps.content: Tie the fishing line on the hoops and eye hook to help the model hang.

steps.title: Enjoy!
steps.content: Enjoy! You can now show off and display your 3D model of the atom oxygen.

steps.title: Prepare your materials.
steps.content: Prepare your materials. You will need 6 wooden craft sticks, strong craft glue, 10 medium-sized Styrofoam blue craft balls, 10 medium-sized Styrofoam red craft balls, and 10 small yellow Styrofoam craft balls.

steps.title: Glue the medium-sized balls together.
steps.content: Glue the medium-sized balls together. Using the strong craft glue, glue both different colored medium-sized balls (the protons and neutrons) together to resemble a nucleus, alternating between the protons and neutrons as you glue.

steps.title: Poke the wooden craft sticks onto different areas of the 'nucleus'.
steps.content: Poke the wooden craft sticks onto different areas of the 'nucleus'. Leave two of the sticks to stand on the ground so the model can stand itself. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Poke and attach the small balls.
steps.content: Poke and attach the small balls. On each craft stick, poke the small yellow balls to resemble electrons.

steps.title: Enjoy!
steps.content: Enjoy! You can now show off and display your 3D model of the atom neon.
